description: A Trademark is a recognizable sign, design, or expression which identifies products or services of a particular source from those of others. This schema is actually for the trademark registration, i.e. not just the mark details, but the record of when it was registered and who holds the trademark. See also http://www.wipo.int/standards/XMLSchema/HTML/ST96TechnicalSpecification/V0-11/TrademarkComponents.html

register.description: The register on which the trademark is listed

holders.description: Details of the holder(s) of the trademark (sometimes called the owners)

correspondent.description: Details of the correspondent (i.e. contact person)

mark_details.description: Details of the trademark itself (rather than the registration)

mark_form.description: The form (i.e. category) of the mark. Sensory marks include smells and sounds

mark_type.description: Free text description of mark type (as provided by register), e.g. 'Illustration', 'Typeset: Word(s)/letter(s)/number(s)'

uid.description: Unique id/reference for the trademark registration

source_url.description: Url of the source of the data (e.g. download URL), or if there is not persistent URL the page from which it can be found (e.g. search page). This field is required.

registration_date.description: Date on which the mark was registered

expiry_date.description: Date on which the registration ended, or is scheduled to expire

start_date.description: This should be the same as registration_date

retrieved_at.description: Date-time this was retrieved from the source

sample_date.description: Date on which we know this to be true (for example the date the trademark data was retrieved if there's no explicit registration date)

other_attributes.description: Use for other attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

nice_classification.title: NICE Trademark Classification
nice_classification.description: A classification from a the WIPO Nice classification system for trademarks. See http://web2.wipo.int/classifications/nice/nicepub/en/fr/edition-20170101/classheadings/ and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_(Nice)_Classification_of_Goods_and_Services

enhanced_descriptions.description: Enhanced descriptions of the classification (may enhance restrict, or otherwise alter standard classification)

nice_enhanced_description.title: Enhanced description for NICE Trademark Classification
nice_enhanced_description.description: NICE Trademark classifications are quite broad, and the specific areas being claimed for are often not for a complete classification but for an arbitrary set of areas, specified in freetext by the trademark owner.

language.description: The language code as 2-letter ISO 639 language code
